intro: Drosanthemum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Drosanthemum longipes is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
